summary: The "right to work" is a fundamental principle enshrined in EU legal frameworks, particularly concerning the rights and freedoms of individuals within the Union. This concept ensures that EU citizens have the liberty to seek employment in any member state without discrimination. It is integral to the promotion of free movement and economic integration, fostering a competitive labor market. The right to work is supported by various EU regulations and directives that aim to eliminate barriers to employment and protect workers' rights, thereby enhancing social cohesion and economic stability across the EU.
